summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the voluntary interview of a Senior Officer Specialist/Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 20, 2019. The interview was conducted in lieu of a grand jury appearance and covers the officer's duties, procedures at MCC, and her observations and knowledge regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein on and around August 9, 2019, the day of his death.

persons.name: Natali Todd
persons.context: Present as an attorney during the FBI interview of the BOP officer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at MCC whose treatment, cellmate assignment, and activities on August 9, 2019, are discussed. The officer recalls seeing him with attorneys earlier that day.

events.title: Epstein's Activities and Return to SHU
events.description: The officer worked as acting Lieutenant and recalls seeing Jeffrey Epstein earlier in the day at the attorney conference area with 3-4 attorneys. Epstein was usually returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) cuffed between 7:20pm and 8pm.

events.title: Epstein's Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: The officer states she only heard things in passing regarding Jeffrey Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: A Senior Officer Specialist/Lieutenant from MCC is interviewed voluntarily at the U.S. Attorney's Office in lieu of a grand jury appearance regarding procedures and her knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The interviewed BOP officer saw Jeffrey Epstein with 3-4 attorneys (2 females, 1 male) in the conference area around 9am on August 9, 2019.
The officer states she is not aware of how either of Epstein's cellmates were selected and that such decisions are made at SHU or department head meetings.
The officer had only heard in passing about Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July and does not know the specific procedures for an inmate coming off suicide watch.
Count paperwork at MCC is kept in the Control Center for 30 days before being shredded.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement and in lieu of a grand jury appearance, indicating its use in the investigation into Epstein's death.
